title: Here's everything new coming to Amazon Prime Video in December 2021
text:
That would be sci-fi epic “The Expanse” (Dec. 10, with new episodes every Friday), which will conclude with its upcoming sixth season. The action picks up amid the solar-system civil war that was set in motion last season, as the crew of the Rocinante reunite and try to turn the tide against Marco Inaros' revolutionaries.

Amazon AMZN also has some big-name debuts, including “Being the Ricardos” (Dec. 21), the Aaron Sorkin-directed movie about behind-the-scenes turmoil on the set of “I Love Lucy,” starring Nicole Kidman and Javier Bardem; “Encounter” (Dec. 10), a sci-fi thriller movie starring Riz Ahmed and Octavia Spencer; “With Love” (Dec. 17), a holiday-themed rom-com series from writer Gloria Calderón Kellett (“One Day at a Time,” “Jane the Virgin”); and “Harlem” (Dec. 3), a new comedy series from writer Tracy Oliver (“Girls Trip”), about four stylish and ambitious friends.

Also see: What's worth streaming in December 2021: ‘The Witcher,' ‘Book of Boba Fett,' ‘Matrix: Resurrections' and more

Soccer fans can look forward to the docuseries “FC Bayern: Behind the Legend” (Dec. 8) and comedy fans will appreciate the return of the year-end special “Yearly Departed” (Dec. 23), featuring an all-star lineup of female comedians roasting 2021.

And more: What's coming in December to Hulu | Amazon Prime Video | HBO Max | Disney+

Prime Video is also adding movies such as “Sleepless in Seattle,” “Ronin,” “Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby” and “The Royal Tennanbaums,” and has four Thursday NFL games, including the Browns-Packers on Christmas Day.

Here's a complete list of what's on tap, as of Nov. 21 (release dates are subject to change):

What's coming in December 2021
